senses.de: A person or thing that carries, holds or delivers something
senses.ex: He became a carrier of the package.

Tips.title: Physical Objects
Tips.description: Used for people or things physically carrying items from one place to another.
Tips.example: The table acted as a carrier for the food spread.

Tips.title: Job Title
Tips.description: Sometimes refers to professional roles, such as a 'mail carrier'.
Tips.example: My uncle worked as a mail carrier for thirty years.

senses.de: A person or animal that has a disease without showing symptoms, but can pass it on to others
senses.ex: She was a carrier of the disease but didn't show any signs.

Tips.title: Silent Spread
Tips.description: Highlights the potential to spread disease while being asymptomatic.
Tips.example: Even without a cough, he was a carrier of the flu.

senses.de: A company that provides services for sending goods or for transport
senses.ex: The carrier will deliver the package tomorrow.

Tips.title: Service Provider
Tips.description: Refers to businesses that transport items or passengers.
Tips.example: The shipping carrier lost my parcel.

Tips.title: Various Types
Tips.description: The term is broad, covering air, sea, and land transport companies.
Tips.example: We need to choose a reliable freight carrier.

senses.de: A signal or frequency that can be modulated to send information
senses.ex: The carrier signal helps transmit data over radio waves.

Tips.title: Technical Term
Tips.description: Used in specific contexts like radio, TV broadcasting, or mobile communication.
Tips.example: My phone says there's no carrier signal here.

Tips.title: Invisible Transfer
Tips.description: Describes an unseen method of transferring information.
Tips.example: The radio station changed its carrier frequency.

senses.de: A large ship for transporting aircraft
senses.ex: The aircraft carrier was sailing in the sea.

Tips.title: Military Vessel
Tips.description: Specifically a large ship designed to deploy and recover aircraft.
Tips.example: The naval fleet was led by an aircraft carrier.

Tips.title: Naval Importance
Tips.description: A symbol of naval power, often central in military discussions.
Tips.example: The country's carrier fleet is a formidable force.

Conduit.wordDefinition:
A conduit is a channel or pipe that transports something, such as water or electricity.

A conduit is used when describing a channel for something to pass through. For example, pipes that carry water through a city are conduits because they are allowing water to flow from one place to another.

A carrier is a means of transportation for people or goods, while a conduit is a channel or pipe that transports something from one place to another.

Convey.wordDefinition:
Convey means to communicate, express, or make known a message, feeling, or idea. It is applicable in the context of communication, language, and expression.

For example, a teacher may convey an idea to their students through a lecture or a writer may convey a message through their writing.

Carrier is related to physically transporting something while convey is related to expressing or communicating a message or idea.

Courier.wordDefinition:
Courier refers to a person or company that delivers important documents or parcels in a timely manner. For instance, a courier service that picks up and delivers passports or legal documents is a courier.

The main difference is that carriers generally transport goods or people, while couriers are focused on delivering important documents or parcels quickly and safely.

Distribute.wordDefinition:
Distribute means to give out or disperse something, often to multiple locations or people. For example, a toy manufacturer may distribute their products to various stores across the country.

A carrier is responsible for physically moving goods or people from one place to another, while distributing involves dispersing those goods or products once they have arrived at their destination.

Messenger.wordDefinition:
Messenger refers to a person who delivers a message from one person to another. For example, a messenger might be hired to deliver an important document from one office to another.

So, while both words involve delivering something from one place to another, carrier is more general and can refer to any type of object, while messenger specifically refers to delivering a message or document from one person to another.

Mover.wordDefinition:
A mover is someone or something that actually physically moves an object or person from one place to another. For example, a person who helps with moving furniture from one house to another is a mover.

A carrier describes the transportation of goods or people, while a mover describes the physical act of moving an object or person from one place to another.

Shipper.wordDefinition:
A shipper is a person or company that actually sends or loads the goods onto the carrier for transportation. For example, if a company wants to ship a product to a customer, they would be the shipper who loads the product onto a carrier like a truck or a shipping container.

The carrier is responsible for transporting the goods or passengers from one place to another, while the shipper is responsible for preparing and loading the goods onto the carrier.

Transport.wordDefinition:
It is applicable in the context of transportation of goods or people.

Transport refers to the act of moving something from one place to another, such as goods or people, through various means like road, rail, air or sea.

Carrier refers to the party delivering or transporting the goods or people, while transport refers to the act of moving things or people from one place to another.
